definition: medicine/drug/substance used for a specific purpose (e.g. poisoning, explosion, fermenting)/CL:種|种[zhong3],服[fu4],味[wei4]/to poison

sentences.english: And the use of cocaine, hallucinogens, steroids, and alcohol by America's youth are all on the decline.
sentences.chinese: 可卡因，迷幻藥，類固醇和酒精的使用也前面下降。

sentences.english: By some freak I was overpaid this month.

sentences.chinese: 迷幻藥真的是神經毒嗎？

sentences.english: Guns that jammed under extreme pressure, and an extraordinary war chest of hallucinogens.
sentences.chinese: 槍在異常的壓力下卡殼了，和一種強烈的迷幻藥。

sentences.english: Then add half a teaspoonful of strychnine.
sentences.chinese: 吃了一堆和士的寧混在一起的迷幻藥？

definition: variant of 獨角戲|独角戏[du2 jiao3 xi4]
see 驢唇不對馬嘴|驴唇不对马嘴[lu:2 chun2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3]
pinyin: niu2 tou2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3

definition: smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
Brave New World, novel by Aldous Huxley 阿道司·赫胥黎[A1 dao4 si1 · He4 xu1 li2]
to perform conjuring tricks/to conjure/to juggle
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
to stir up public sentiment by false statements (idiom)/to resort to demagogy
